intro: Rhysolepis mollis, commonly known as the slender rockspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive lobed or serrated appearance. Rhysolepis mollis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
